alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Pope (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 9:44AM CST until January 11 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Golconda affecting Crittenden, Livingston, Hardin and Pope Counties. .Heavy rain from last weekend continues to drain into the Ohio River basin causing rises along the river, including at Golconda. This will cause a brief rise into minor flood stage early next week. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Golconda. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 36.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday afternoon to a crest of 40.0 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
